bibl.title: Nishikawa Mamoru v. T.W. Lynch. Order to Show Cause and Restraining Order
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

org.orgName: The District Court of the United States, Western District of Washington, Northern Division

div1.p: Order to Show Cause and Restraining Order
In the Matter of the Application of NISHIKAWA MAMORU for WRIT OF HABEAS CORPUS
T.W. Lynch, Acting Commissioner of Immigration, Responent.
This matter coming on to be heard upon the application of the petitioner herein for writ of habeas corpus, and the Court having read the petition and being now fully advised in the premises,

IT IS ORDERED AND DIRECTEE that Thomas W. Lynch, Acting Commissioner of Immigration, and to divers and sundry inspectors of immigration and employees of the Bureau of Immigration at the Port of Seattle in charge of the Immigration Station at said Seattle, King County, Washington, be, and they and each of them hereby are, required to be and appear in the Court room of the United States District Court, at Seattle, King County, Washington, in the Post Office Building, at the hour of two o'clock on the 28th day of November, 1921, then and there show cause, if any there be, why the writ of habeas corpus prayed for in the petition filed herein should not issue in accordance with the prayer of said petitioner.

IT IS FURTHER ORDERED AND DIRECTED that the above named Thomas W. Lynch, as Acting Commissioner of Immigration in charge of the United States Immigration Station at Seattle, Washington, together with all such inspectors and other persons acting under and by his authority, be, and each of them hereby are, enjoined and restrained from removing said petitioner from the City of Seattle and from and out of the jurisdiction of this Court pending the hearing and return upon this application for a writ of habeas corpus.
DONE in Open Court this 25 day of November, 1921.
Filed in the United States District Court
